skillTree.localised_description: A Bellowerâ€™s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield and encouraging unbridled carnage.
A small handful of Gnoblars surround this Ogre Lord, their swords always ready to cut and carve.
It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(all units in army)

Recruit rank: +2 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Once the other tribes laughed when Greasus demanded they pay him tribute. The fools would be laughing on the other side of their faces, if indeed they still had facesâ€¦

effects.description:
Population surplus: +1 for newly-captured settlements
	(Lord's army)

Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Just as Greasus' form has grown to such absurd proportions, so does his unfathomable wealth.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can never have its Melee Attack reduced during battle.
This unit can never have its Melee Attack reduced during battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Step 1: Grease up your Gnoblars! Step 2: Go faster!

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: There are no war camps in all the land to rival those of Greasus Goldtooth.
The largest wealth draws the largest warriors, and few are so wealthy as Greasus Goldtooth.

effects.description:
Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn for large units (minimum 1)
	(own local province)

Weapon strength: +10% for large units
	(Lord's army)

Local Recruitment duration: -2 turn for large units (minimum 1)
	(own local province)

Weapon strength: +20% for large units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If flesh and conquest are your deepest desire, the Tyrant of all Tyrants is happy to provide.

effects.description:
Lord and Hero recruit rank: +2(HIDDEN - used for applying to Hordes)
	(own armies factionwide)
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

Unlocks Hero recruitment for all Heroes
	(own local province)

Upkeep: -20% for Gnoblars, Pigback Riders and Gnoblar Scraplauncher units
	(own armies in province)

Melee defence: +10 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(own armies in province)

skillTree.localised_description: This Tyrant is the size of several large creatures rolled into one. In fact, he ate those several large creatures just yesterday.
Mountains of gold and an overflowing meat-pot are bound to draw in the strongest of warriors.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -20% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is not enough to impose military defeat upon the foe, they must be brought to their knees through punitive taxationâ€¦ unless they'd rather get in the meat-pot instead?

effects.description:
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +20%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: No enemy is immovable when in the path of a furious Ogre's charge.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
This Ogre's greed shall never be sated, for his stomach is as endless as his hunger.
A truly sturdy armour is needed to hold such an overflowing gut in place.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
If the enormous size of this Ogre doesn't incite terror, his bloody, malevolent smile surely will.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When an Ogre charges, the ground itself begins to quake. As it should.

Melee attack: +2 for Ogre Bulls units

skillTree.localised_description: Though their intelligence is as pitiful as their physique, one would be a fool not to fear the Gnoblars when massed in numbers.

skillTree.localised_description: If there's one thing more horrifying than being rushed by a hulking, bloodthirsty beast, it's being rushed by that same creature riding on the back of another equally hulking, bloodthirsty beast.

skillTree.localised_description: The Ogres' true firepower is as destructive and indelicate as the Ogres themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Even ferocious brutes like the Ironguts and Maneaters fight harder in the presence of a worthy leader.

skillTree.localised_description: What the monstrous creatures of the mountains lack in guile, they more than make up for in their stubborn reluctance to die.

skillTree.localised_description: To the most brutal, vicious killer go the richest spoils.

skillTree.localised_description: When pelting a helpless enemy with heavy projectiles is so much fun, why bother stopping?

skillTree.localised_description: When fearsome, brute strength is combined with terrifying speed, the petty weaklings among the enemy can only wet themselves in fear.

skillTree.localised_description: Driven by ravenous hunger, the Maneaters feast on the flesh of the fallen.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!

effects.description:
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +5%
	(Lord's army)

Income from sacking and looting settlements: +10%
	(Lord's army)

Income from sacking and looting settlements: +15%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ogres flock to this Butcher's camp, eager for the chance to witness the Great Maw's malevolent power.
Even Ogres are capable of forward planning, especially when it comes to precious loot.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This ravening Ogre Lord is but a mere symbol of his god, whose cancerous power reigns over the Mountains of Mourn.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.
The mysterious powers of the Great Maw can heal even the deepest of wounds.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.
Witnessing other friendly units rout will only affect this unit's leadership if they also have the Contempt attribute.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

ui_effects.localised_text: Increases this unit's ability to knock enemies back while active

stat_effects.description: x0.025 Dealt Collision Knocked Back Threshold
x0.025 Dealt Collision Knocked Down Threshold
x0.02 Dealt Collision Knocked Flying Threshold

factionEffects.localised_description: Greasus Goldtooth is the fattest and most powerful Ogre Tyrant within the entire Ogre Kingdoms and holds the current title of Overtyrant, the Tyrant of all Ogre Tyrants.
factionEffects.localised_title: Tradelord Greasus Tribestealer Drakecrush Gatecrasher Hoardmaster Goldtooth the Shockingly Obese

effects.description: Has access to Tyrant's Demands, enabling special campaign actions
Experience gain for units: +50% when fighting against Ogre Kingdoms for every Tyrant

Experience gain: +100% for Gnoblars and Hobgoblins units
	(own armies factionwide in enemy territory)

items.colour_text: This massive sceptre is ensorcelled with spells of might, imbuing Greasus with the strength of a Sky-Titan, as befits his status as the most powerful Ogre alive.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

item_set.name: Da Crown Jewelz
item_set.description: Da shiniest of sceptres and pimpiest crown, only the Overtyrant can wear 'em.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +50% for alliances with Ogre Kingdoms

items.colour_text: This enchanted, basin-sized crown was forged by artisans of the Empire for a king's ransom in gold, and is said to increase Overtyrant's intellect to near-human levels.
